Besides extensive development and training opportunities, we offer flexible working options, 18 weeks of maternity leave and 10 weeks of gender independent partnership leave. Our employees also benefit from multiple services on site such as child-care facilities, medical services, restaurants and cafeterias, as well as various employee events.

We believe in the power of diversity and inclusion, and strive to identify and create opportunities that enable all people to bring their unique selves to Roche.

Roche is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
About InvestCloud

InvestCloud is at the forefront of wealth technology, offering innovative solutions that redefine how the financial services industry operates. With a global presence and a client-first approach, we specialize in digital transformations powered by our flexible, modular technology.

About

About the Team

You will be joining the newly formed AI, Data & Analytics team, primarily responsible as a Data Scientist leading various projects within the small AI team. The new team is focused on driving increased value from the data InvestCloud captures to enable a smarter financial future for our clients, in particular focused on “enhanced intelligence”. Ensuring we have fit-for-purpose modern capabilities is a key goal for the team.

We are seeking a Senior Data Scientist / Machine Learning Engineer with a background in Data Science, Machine Learning, and Generative AI models. The ideal candidate should have a proven track record in delivering business impact and delighting clients by developing and deploying ML and AI models in production, along with excellent problem-solving skills. In this role you will integrate AI and ML solutions into the InvestCloud product suite.

Key Responsibilities


Implement applications powered by Generative AI and Machine Learning models and deploy them in production
Develop and maintain datasets and data pipelines to support Machine Learning model training and deployment
Interpret results from Machine Learning models and communicate findings to both technical and non-technical stakeholders
Stay updated with the latest advancements in Machine Learning, natural language processing, and generative AI.
Analyse large datasets to identify patterns, trends, and insights that can inform business decisions.
Work with 3rd party providers of AI products to evaluate and implement solutions achieving Investcloud’s business objectives.


Required Skills


MSc degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Data Science, Machine Learning, or a related technical field or equivalent practical experience
At least four years of professional experience in Data Science, Machine Learning and AI
Outstanding communications skills in English
Proficiency in programming in Python
Knowledge of Machine Learning frameworks (Scikit-learn) and LLM frameworks (e.g. Langchain)
Knowledge of data preprocessing, feature engineering and model evaluation metrics
Experience using large language models, generative AI and agentic frameworks
Experience in database technologies (Oracle, PostgreSQL)
Experience working with Snowflake and/or Databricks or similar tools
Working experience developing and deploying Machine Learning models in production
Working experience with Git and Docker
Working proficiency in English
Strong communication skills to engage with non-technical stakeholders
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment, working across multiple projects simultaneously
Ability to collaborate effectively as a team player, fostering a culture of open communication and mutual respect.


Preferred Skills


Working experience with Vector Database Technologies
Experience with cloud platforms such as AWS, GCP, or Azure


What Do We Offer

Join our diverse and international cross-functional team, comprising data scientists, product managers, business analyst and software engineers. As a key member of our team, you will have the opportunity to implement cutting-edge technology to create a next-generation advisor and client experience.

Location and Travel

The ideal candidate will be expected to work from the office on a regular basis (3 days minimum per week). Occasional travel may be required.

Compensation

The salary range will be determined based on experience, skills, and geographic location. Visa sponsorship is not available for this role.

Equal Opportunity Employer

InvestCloud is committed to fostering an inclusive workplace and welcomes applicants from all backgrounds.
Show more
HTML:
About InvestCloud

InvestCloud is at the forefront of wealth technology, offering innovative solutions that redefine how the financial services industry operates. With a global presence and a client-first approach, we specialize in digital transformations powered by our flexible, modular technology.

About

About the Team

You will be joining the newly formed AI, Data & Analytics team, primarily responsible as a Data Scientist leading various projects within the small AI team. The new team is focused on driving increased value from the data InvestCloud captures to enable a smarter financial future for our clients, in particular focused on “enhanced intelligence”. Ensuring we have fit-for-purpose modern capabilities is a key goal for the team.

We are seeking a Senior Data Scientist / Machine Learning Engineer with a background in Data Science, Machine Learning, and Generative AI models. The ideal candidate should have a proven track record in delivering business impact and delighting clients by developing and deploying ML and AI models in production, along with excellent problem-solving skills. In this role you will integrate AI and ML solutions into the InvestCloud product suite.

Key Responsibilities

  • Implement applications powered by Generative AI and Machine Learning models and deploy them in production
  • Develop and maintain datasets and data pipelines to support Machine Learning model training and deployment
  • Interpret results from Machine Learning models and communicate findings to both technical and non-technical stakeholders
  • Stay updated with the latest advancements in Machine Learning, natural language processing, and generative AI.
  • Analyse large datasets to identify patterns, trends, and insights that can inform business decisions.
  • Work with 3rd party providers of AI products to evaluate and implement solutions achieving Investcloud’s business objectives.

Required Skills

  • MSc degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Data Science, Machine Learning, or a related technical field or equivalent practical experience
  • At least four years of professional experience in Data Science, Machine Learning and AI
  • Outstanding communications skills in English
  • Proficiency in programming in Python
  • Knowledge of Machine Learning frameworks (Scikit-learn) and LLM frameworks (e.g. Langchain)
  • Knowledge of data preprocessing, feature engineering and model evaluation metrics
  • Experience using large language models, generative AI and agentic frameworks
  • Experience in database technologies (Oracle, PostgreSQL)
  • Experience working with Snowflake and/or Databricks or similar tools
  • Working experience developing and deploying Machine Learning models in production
  • Working experience with Git and Docker
  • Working proficiency in English
  • Strong communication skills to engage with non-technical stakeholders
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced environment, working across multiple projects simultaneously
  • Ability to collaborate effectively as a team player, fostering a culture of open communication and mutual respect.

Preferred Skills

  • Working experience with Vector Database Technologies
  • Experience with cloud platforms such as AWS, GCP, or Azure

What Do We Offer

Join our diverse and international cross-functional team, comprising data scientists, product managers, business analyst and software engineers. As a key member of our team, you will have the opportunity to implement cutting-edge technology to create a next-generation advisor and client experience.

Location and Travel

The ideal candidate will be expected to work from the office on a regular basis (3 days minimum per week). Occasional travel may be required.

Compensation

The salary range will be determined based on experience, skills, and geographic location. Visa sponsorship is not available for this role.

Equal Opportunity Employer

InvestCloud is committed to fostering an inclusive workplace and welcomes applicants from all backgrounds.

Title: Ingénieur·e ML Ops
Description:
Rejoignez Novatix, un des leaders en solutions d'Intelligence Artificielle (IA) et de Machine Learning en Suisse Romande, maintenant membre du groupe Ansam. Nous aidons les organisations à tirer parti de l'IA en les accompagnant de la stratégie à la mise en production : conseil, développement de solutions sur mesure, intégration, maintenance et formation. Notre équipe d’expert·e·s passionné·e·s est dédiée à l’innovation continue et à la création de valeur pour nos clients.

Chez ANSAM, la diversité, l’équité et l’inclusion sont des éléments clés de notre ADN. Nous nous engageons à offrir à chacun·e de nos collaborateur·rice·s l'opportunité de grandir, réussir et se développer, quel que soit leur profil. Nous croyons que la diversité est essentielle à notre succès. Si vous partagez nos valeurs et que vous répondez aux critères du poste, nous vous encourageons à postuler. Nous sommes ouverts à toutes les candidatures, y compris celles nécessitant des adaptations spécifiques.

Résumé du Poste

En tant qu’Ingénieur·e MLOps, vous jouerez un rôle clé dans la mise en place et la maintenance de l’infrastructure IA et des pipelines de déploiement pour nos solutions d’intelligence artificielle et de Machine Learning. Vous travaillerez à la scalabilité, l’automatisation et l’optimisation des workflows ML, tout en garantissant des pratiques robustes en CI/CD et gestion d’infrastructure.

Si vous êtes passionné·e par l’automatisation, le cloud et la mise en production de modèles IA, nous voulons vous rencontrer !

Opportunités de Formation

Nous savons que le domaine de l’MLOps évolue rapidement, c’est pourquoi nous proposons un programme de formation on-the-job approfondi pour vous aider à vous perfectionner dans les nouvelles technologies d’orchestration, d’automatisation et de gestion d’infrastructure ML.

Dès votre arrivée, vous bénéficierez d’un parcours de formation dynamique combinant ateliers pratiques, mentorat et sessions techniques avancées avec nos expert·e·s en MLOps et DevOps.

Responsabilités


Développer et maintenir l’infrastructure MLOps pour l’automatisation du cycle de vie des modèles IA.
Créer et gérer des pipelines de déploiement CI/CD pour accélérer la mise en production des modèles ML.
Déployer et orchestrer des conteneurs avec Docker et Kubernetes sur des environnements cloud et on-premise.
Optimiser l’infrastructure IA pour la scalabilité et la performance en exploitant les meilleures pratiques DevOps et CloudOps.
Mettre en place des solutions de monitoring et de logging avancées pour assurer la robustesse et la fiabilité des déploiements IA.
Gérer l’infrastructure en tant que code (IaC) en utilisant Terraform et d’autres outils d’automatisation.
Sécuriser les environnements de production IA en intégrant des standards de sécurité (IAM, chiffrement, gestion des API).
Collaborer avec les équipes Data Science et Software Engineering pour optimiser l’industrialisation des modèles IA.



Qualifications


4+ ans d’expérience en DevOps/MLOps avec un focus sur le déploiement de modèles IA en production.
Maîtrise des pipelines CI/CD et des outils associés (GitHub Actions, GitLab CI, Jenkins).
Solide expérience en Docker et Kubernetes pour le déploiement et l’orchestration des modèles ML.
Expertise sur les plateformes cloud (AWS, GCP, Azure) et leurs services IA.
Bonne connaissance des solutions Infrastructure as Code (Terraform, CloudFormation, Pulumi).
Expérience en gestion et monitoring des modèles IA (Prometheus, Grafana, MLflow).
Bonne compréhension des enjeux de sécurité IA et cloud.
Langues : Maîtrise du français et de l’anglais.



Atouts Supplémentaires


Expérience avec les bases de données et les data lakes (Snowflake, Databricks, BigQuery).
Connaissance en GPU computing et optimisation des performances IA (NVIDIA CUDA, TensorRT).
Familiarité avec les architectures serverless (AWS Lambda, Azure Functions).



Pourquoi Rejoindre Novatix ?


💰 Un package de rémunération compétitif : Un salaire attractif à la hauteur de votre expertise.
🎓 Des opportunités de formation continue : Développement professionnel et apprentissage des dernières technologies.
🏡 Flexibilité et équilibre vie pro/perso : Télétravail et horaires aménagés.
🌍 Culture d’entreprise forte et inclusive : Une équipe où chaque voix compte et où l’innovation est au cœur des projets.
🚀 Travailler sur des projets IA et Data Science innovants : Contribution à des solutions Data à fort impact.



Aujourd'hui, l'informatique transcende et transforme tous les secteurs de l'entreprise, devenant un élément incontournable de votre succès. Chez ANSAM nous croyons que l'IT doit devenir une véritable ressource pour les entreprises permettant de créer de la valeur ajoutée. Concrétiser son impact implique une collaboration étroite et quotidienne, où le partage joue un rôle crucial.
Show more

Aujourd'hui, l'informatique transcende et transforme tous les secteurs de l'entreprise, devenant un élément incontournable de votre succès. Title: Spontanbewerbung bei SPOUD
Description:
Du willst mit Daten arbeiten, an spannenden Projekten tüfteln in einem innovativen Umfeld wachsen und dir ist Kafka ein Begriff?




Auch wenn wir gerade keine offene Stelle ausgeschrieben haben – wir sind immer neugierig auf neue Talente!


Aufgaben



Mitwirkung an Softwareprojekten in einem innovativen, datengetriebenen Umfeld


Gestaltung der Softwarearchitektur und des technischen Designs


Unterstützung unserer Kunden bei der Entwicklung ihrer technischen Vision


Beitrag zur Weiterentwicklung unseres Teams, unserer Technologien und Mitgestalltung unserer Vision


Coaching und Mentoring für junge Softwareentwickler:innen auf ihrem Weg zum Senior



Qualifikation



Erfahrung in der Softwareentwicklung und Interesse an Daten & Streaming-Technologien


Kenntnisse in modernen Programmiersprachen & Frameworks


Teamplayer mit eigenständiger, lösungsorientierter Arbeitsweise


Gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse





Egal, ob du Software Engineer, Data Enthusiast oder Tech Visionär bist – wenn du Lust hast, mit uns die Welt der Echtzeitdaten zu revolutionieren, dann schick uns deine Spontanbewerbung! Wir freuen uns, von dir zu hören! 🚀

Title: Data Scientist / Data Engineer WomenHack Talentpool
Description:
Thank you for attending WomenHack! We appreciate your interest in our Data Scientist and/or Data Engineer openings.

We are currently hiring for three teams: Digital Experience, SSE, and SD-WAN.

To move forward, please send us your resume and provide the necessary information to complete your application. We will review your submission and get back to you as soon as possible.

Below, you’ll find some details about the typical work our Data Scientists are involved in. This list is not exhaustive so if you are a Talented Data Scientist or Data Engineer please leave us your details anyway!

Looking forward to hearing from you!

Data Scientist sneak peek:

Key Responsibilities



Language Model Development: Research, design, and develop advanced language models, including transformer-based architectures like BERT, GPT, and XLNet.
NLP Application: Apply NLP techniques to solve complex business problems, such as sentiment analysis, text classification, named entity recognition, and language translation.
Text Data Preprocessing: Clean, preprocess, and transform unstructured text data into a suitable format for analysis, ensuring data quality and consistency.
LM Fine-tuning: Fine-tune pre-trained language models for specific tasks and domains, optimizing model performance and accuracy.
Data Analysis: Conduct exploratory data analysis (EDA) on text data to uncover patterns, insights, and trends. Collaborate with data engineers to acquire and prepare relevant data.
Model Evaluation: Develop and implement evaluation metrics and techniques to assess the performance of language models and NLP applications.
NLP Algorithms: Research and implement state-of-the-art NLP algorithms and techniques, staying up-to-date with the latest advancements in the field.
Collaboration: Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including data engineers, software engineers, and business analysts, to integrate NLP solutions into our products and services.
Documentation: Maintain comprehensive documentation of LM and NLP models, methodologies, and processes for knowledge sharing within the team.



What we expect from you:



Proven experience as a Data Scientist with a focus on Language Models and NLP, including experience with transformer models.
Strong programming skills in languages such as Python and familiarity with deep learning frameworks like TensorFlow or PyTorch.
Proficiency in NLP libraries and tools (NLTK, spaCy, Hugging Face Transformers, etc.).
Knowledge of data analysis and visualization tools.
ETH, university or FH degree in Computer Science or equivalent
Fluent in English, German is a plus.



Furthermore, we expect basic knowledge and a high motivation to participate a coached training program in these areas:



Knowledge of Linux operating systems
Experience with managing Infrastructure as a Service resources of public cloud providers (Azure, AWS, GCP,...) with Terraform.
You have a passion for sustainable software development and you gathered experiences in other technical positions already.
In-depth knowledge and experience of at least one programming language: Python, Go, Scala, Java



What we offer:

Want to join a team that enjoys making secure connectivity simple for our customers? You’ll be among people who believe in:

Caring PASSIONATELY about keeping our customers safe – We’re dedicated to solving problems. Whatever it takes.

Thinking UNCONVENTIONALLY to stay ahead – The world never fails to surprise us. So let’s surprise it first.

Doing the hard work to make things SIMPLE – Craft and hone something that delights in its simplicity.

Working COLLABORATIVELY to build success – The power of the team will always make us faster and better.

As a testament to this, Open Systems has been recognised as an outstanding place to work. You’ll be surrounded by smart teams who enrich your experience and provide opportunities you will need to develop your skills and advance your career. 

We look forward to receiving your online application (please note that you need to compress your application into two attachments). Only direct applications will be considered.
Show more

Title: Principal Scientist – Crop Protection Research Chemistry (m/f/d)
Description:
Company Description

Syngenta Group, a global leader in agricultural technology and innovation, employs 60,000 people across more than 100 countries to transform agriculture through tailor-made solutions for farmers, society, and our planet. Our diverse portfolio encompasses seeds, crop protection, nutrition products, agronomic solutions, and digital services, all designed to help farmers produce healthy food, feed, fiber, and fuel while conserving natural resources and protecting the environment. Our mission is to address critical challenges such as climate change and food security through sustainable practices and cutting-edge solutions, while safeguarding the planet's resources.

At our R&D Center in Stein AG, Switzerland, the Crop Protection Research (CPR) Chemistry team is at the forefront of innovation. Here, you will design and synthesize novel products that promote crop health and contribute to the evolution of agricultural practices. Your work will play a crucial role in advancing our mission to ensure global food security through sustainable solutions.

Syngenta has been ranked as a top employer by Science Magazine and it has been awarded with the "Friendly Work Space" label to all its Swiss sites.

Job Description

Your responsibilities:


Collaborate in multidisciplinary project teams with local and global experts to drive discovery programs to develop sustainable crop protection solutions.
Lead and contribute to chemistry research projects, applying state-of-art target-based discovery approaches to identify and optimize novel bioactive ingredients interacting with relevant biological targets for crop protection.
Advance project delivery through scientific investigations, applying expertise in molecular design, physical organic chemistry, and synthetic problem-solving.
Analyze and deconvolute complex structure-activity-relationships (SAR) by integrating experimental and predicted data to meet key project deliverables.
Drive scientific advancement and technological innovation in modern agrochemical discovery by proactively developing and applying cutting-edge skills and technologies, while fostering a culture of continuous learning, creativity, and strategic foresight.


Qualifications

What we are looking for:


Deep expertise in organic chemistry, chemical biology or medicinal chemistry through doctoral training; postdoctoral and/or industrial experience is valued, yet not essential.
Scientific experience in drug discovery technologies, and proficiency in synthetic organic chemistry.
Excellent interpersonal and collaboration skills, with demonstrated ability to effectively participate in scientific collaborations, fostering productive teamwork in multidisciplinary environments
Forward-thinking mindset with a proactive approach to emerging trends and technologies in the field, coupled with strong self-motivation and initiative in project execution and personal growth.
Good English language skills with demonstrated ability to communicate complex scientific concepts effectively and enable cross-functional engagement.


What You Bring To Our Team


Passion for life science technologies, including small molecules and new chemical modalities.
Enthusiasm for applying and championing cutting-edge science and digital technologies.
Creativity, curiosity, and strong decision-making skills with a commitment to continuous learning.
Excellent organizational and time management abilities
Collaborative mindset with strong communication skills to build productive relationships within Syngenta and with international collaborators
Dedication to welcoming different perspectives and fostering a diverse, inclusive and open work environment.


Additional Information

What we offer:


We provide access to state-of-the-art research facilities and technologies, enabling you to apply and expand your expertise in agrochemical design principles, synthetic organic chemistry, and active ingredient optimization.
We cultivate a superb working environment with an open culture and diverse workforce, where new ideas are always welcome. We embrace flexible work arrangements and foster work-life balance.
We foster a digitally-enhanced research environment throughout our R&D processes. This offers you the opportunity to develop digital data analysis skills, positioning you at the forefront of drug discovery.
We invest in your professional growth and development through a multidisciplinary training program tailored to foster a rewarding career in crop protection.
We are part of a strong regional Science hub, offering you the opportunity to interact with a rich community of scientists in life sciences, further enhancing your professional network and knowledge exchange.
You will profit from a competitive pension fund plan, attractive bonus system, onsite doctor, fitness room, canteen, and other benefits (Family friendly initiatives, Child and Family allowance…)


Are you interested? Please send your complete application with CV, cover letter, diploma and work certificates (if applicable).

Syngenta is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate in recruitment, hiring, training, promotion or any other employment practices for reasons of race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, sexual orientation, marital or veteran status, disability, or any other legally protected status

  • Lead and contribute to chemistry research projects, applying state-of-art target-based discovery approaches to identify and optimize novel bioactive ingredients interacting with relevant biological targets for crop protection.
  • Advance project delivery through scientific investigations, applying expertise in molecular design, physical organic chemistry, and synthetic problem-solving.
  • Analyze and deconvolute complex structure-activity-relationships (SAR) by integrating experimental and predicted data to meet key project deliverables.
  • Drive scientific advancement and technological innovation in modern agrochemical discovery by proactively developing and applying cutting-edge skills and technologies, while fostering a culture of continuous learning, creativity, and strategic foresight.

Qualifications

What we are looking for:

  • Deep expertise in organic chemistry, chemical biology or medicinal chemistry through doctoral training; postdoctoral and/or industrial experience is valued, yet not essential.
  • Scientific experience in drug discovery technologies, and proficiency in synthetic organic chemistry.
  • Excellent interpersonal and collaboration skills, with demonstrated ability to effectively participate in scientific collaborations, fostering productive teamwork in multidisciplinary environments
  • Forward-thinking mindset with a proactive approach to emerging trends and technologies in the field, coupled with strong self-motivation and initiative in project execution and personal growth.
  • Good English language skills with demonstrated ability to communicate complex scientific concepts effectively and enable cross-functional engagement.

What You Bring To Our Team

  • Passion for life science technologies, including small molecules and new chemical modalities.
  • Enthusiasm for applying and championing cutting-edge science and digital technologies.
  • Creativity, curiosity, and strong decision-making skills with a commitment to continuous learning.
  • Excellent organizational and time management abilities
  • Collaborative mindset with strong communication skills to build productive relationships within Syngenta and with international collaborators
  • Dedication to welcoming different perspectives and fostering a diverse, inclusive and open work environment.

Additional Information

What we offer:

  • We provide access to state-of-the-art research facilities and technologies, enabling you to apply and expand your expertise in agrochemical design principles, synthetic organic chemistry, and active ingredient optimization.
  • We cultivate a superb working environment with an open culture and diverse workforce, where new ideas are always welcome. We embrace flexible work arrangements and foster work-life balance.
  • We foster a digitally-enhanced research environment throughout our R&D processes. This offers you the opportunity to develop digital data analysis skills, positioning you at the forefront of drug discovery.
  • We invest in your professional growth and development through a multidisciplinary training program tailored to foster a rewarding career in crop protection.
  • We are part of a strong regional Science hub, offering you the opportunity to interact with a rich community of scientists in life sciences, further enhancing your professional network and knowledge exchange.
  • You will profit from a competitive pension fund plan, attractive bonus system, onsite doctor, fitness room, canteen, and other benefits (Family friendly initiatives, Child and Family allowance…)

Are you interested? Please send your complete application with CV, cover letter, diploma and work certificates (if applicable).

Syngenta is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate in recruitment, hiring, training, promotion or any other employment practices for reasons of race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, sexual orientation, marital or veteran status, disability, or any other legally protected status

Title: Head of Data Science & Modeling R&D (f/m/d) 80-100%
Description:
Switzerland, Basel

Switzerland, Visp

Location, Visp.

Today, Lonza is a global leader in life sciences operating across five continents. While we work in science, there’s no magic formula to how we do it. Our greatest scientific solution is talented people working together, devising ideas that help businesses to help people. In exchange, we let our people own their careers. Their ideas, big and small, genuinely improve the world. And that’s the kind of work we want to be part of.

The role's purpose and scope are to Lead the SM data science and modeling strategy/ roadmap across the business platform to generate unique insights from data and develop new differentiated offerings using modeling tools. The incumbent will lead a team of expert data scientists/engineers, programmers and modeling experts (AI, mechanistic, statistical) deployed across multiple projects to enable the deployment of industry-leading data science and modeling capabilities.

What You’ll Get


An agile career and dynamic working culture in a growing environment.
An inclusive and ethical workplace.
Compensation programs that recognize high performance.
A variety of competitive benefits.


What You’ll Do


Act as strategic lead for data science and modeling across the organization (R&D, MSAT, dev services, etc) and partner with relevant leads in other Business platforms.
Effectively manage resources and projects in line with prioritized business needs.
Support all business areas (chemistry, bio enhancement, oral drug product, drug delivery), functions (R&D, operations, quality, etc) and sites.
Ensure advanced data science and modeling is a key enabler across our innovation pipeline and operations.
Partner with IT Hub and spoke with contacts to ensure aligned strategy and investment.
Ensure effective deployment of data ops/flows and visualization and modeling tools in operations, and services, through simplified workbenches, workflows, and apps as well as training.
Accelerate the adoption of AI/ML as well as statistical and mechanistic modeling in the organization including through partnerships / external collaborations.
Work closely with other SMEs (IT, Automation, analytical, etc) to ensure alignment of project and priorities.


What We’re Looking For


PhD in Science, an equivalent professional qualification or occupational experience in Chemical engineering, statistics, chem-informatics/chemometrics .
Minimum of 10 years of experience leading/managing projects, including technology projects, in a pharmaceutical /CDMO setting .
Solid experience delivering strong value (new offerings, acceleration, etc) through the development and deployment of modeling tools in a pharmaceutical /CDMO environment.
Demonstrated ability to operate in a complex matrix environment.
Proven track record /scientific expertise in the development and deployment of complex modeling tools, programming, electronic lab notebooks, apps,etc
Established collaboration network and external recognition as SME in the field
Ability to operate at multiple levels from strategic planning to site operational deployment in line with broader R&D and BU objectives .
Support own and matrix team resource planning, project management activities and prioritization decisions.
Strong communication skills and capacity to translate technical information into business insights for decision-making process.


Every day, Lonza’s products and services have a positive impact on millions of people. For us, this is not only a great privilege, but also a great responsibility. How we achieve our business results is just as important as the achievements themselves. At Lonza, we respect and protect our people and our environment. Any success we achieve is no success at all if not achieved ethically.

People come to Lonza for the challenge and creativity of solving complex problems and developing new ideas in life sciences. In return, we offer the satisfaction that comes with improving lives all around the world. The satisfaction that comes with making a meaningful difference.

Lonza is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, status as a qualified individual with disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Title: Research Engineer, Data (Foundational Research, Machine Learning)
Description:
Are you a curious and open-minded individual with an interest in state-of-the-art machine learning engineering and research? Thomson Reuters Labs is seeking a Data Engineer with a passion for solving challenging machine learning problems in a data-rich, complex and innovative environment.

What does Thomson Reuters Labs do? We experiment, we build, we deliver. We support the organization and our product teams through foundational research and development of new products and technologies. The Labs innovate collaboratively across our core segments in Legal, Tax & Accounting, Government, and Reuters News. We undertake a diverse portfolio of projects while investing in long-term research for the future.

As a Research Engineer, you will be part of a diverse global team of experts. We hire worldleading specialists in SWE /Applied ML, as well as Research, to drive the company’s leading internal AI model development, fueled by an unprecedented wealth of data and powered by cutting-edge technical infrastructure. You will have the opportunity to contribute to a data curation & filtering system combining the best of real-world scalable data processing systems combined with the latest insights into what training data leads to the best LLMs. Thomson Reuters Labs is known for consistently delivering successful datadriven Artificial Intelligence solutions in support of high-growth products that serve Thomson Reuters customers in new and exciting ways.

About the Role:

In this opportunity as a Research Engineer - Data, you will:


Innovate: You will work at the very cutting edge of AI Research at an institution with some of the richest data sources in the world. Through your work, you will help us make the best use of this resource, in a dynamic flywheel that connects data collection & annotation with model training and expert evaluation, helping us continuously improve our training data. You will also develop novel performance-driven data sub-selection methods together with the latest training insights from our researchers.
Engineer and Develop: Design, develop, and optimize scalable data pipelines to support LLM training and evaluation. You will also help us develop this in a robust and testable way, through careful source control and a solid back-up system for various data versioning methods.
Collaborate: Working on a collaborative global team of engineers and scientists both within Thomson Reuters and our academic partners at world-leading universities. In addition, you will work closely with world experts in the legal domain, which can provide feedback to your work and/or evaluate your outputs or annotate training data.



About You:

You're a fit for the role of Research Engineer - Data, if your background includes:

Required qualifications:


Relevant degree in a technical discipline.
Interest in & experience working with (applied) machine learning, e.g. few-shot learning with out-of-the-box language models, training of smaller NLP classifiers, etc.
Excellent programming, debugging and system design skills.
Excellent communication skills to report and present software designs and findings clearly, both orally and in writing.
Curious and innovative disposition capable of devising novel, well-founded algorithmic solutions to relevant problems.
Self-driven attitude and ability to work with limited supervision.
Experience with relational and NoSQL databases (e.g., PostgreSQL, MySQL, MongoDB, Cassandra).
Experience with data pipeline orchestration tools.
Experience with cloud-based data platforms such as AWS, GCP, or Azure (e.g., S3, BigQuery, Azure Data Lake Storage).
Comfortable working in fast-paced, agile environments, managing uncertainty and ambiguity.



Preferred qualifications:


Additional legal knowledge as evidenced by a degree or interest in the legal domain.
Ability to communicate with multiple stakeholders, including non-technical legal subject matter experts.
Experience with big data technologies such as Spark, Hadoop, or similar.
Experience conducting world-leading research, e.g. by contributions to publications at leading ML venues.
Previous experience working on large-scale data processing systems.
Strong software and/or infrastructure engineering skills, as evidenced by code contributions to popular open-source libraries.



What’s in it For You?

Join us to inform the way forward with the latest AI solutions and address real-world challenges in legal, tax, compliance, and news. Backed by our commitment to continuous learning and market-leading benefits, you’ll be prepared to grow, lead, and thrive in an AI-enabled future. This includes:


Industry-Leading Benefits: We offer comprehensive benefit plans to include flexible vacation, two company-wide Mental Health Days off, access to the Headspace app, retirement savings, tuition reimbursement, employee incentive programs, and resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing.
Flexibility & Work-Life Balance: Flex My Way is a set of supportive workplace policies designed to help manage personal and professional responsibilities, whether caring for family, giving back to the community, or finding time to refresh and reset. This builds upon our flexible work arrangements, including work from anywhere for up to 8 weeks per year, and hybrid model, empowering employees to achieve a better work-life balance.
Career Development and Growth: By fostering a culture of continuous learning and skill development, we prepare our talent to tackle tomorrow’s challenges and deliver real-world solutions. Our skills-first approach ensures you have the tools and knowledge to grow, lead, and thrive in an AI-enabled future.
Culture: Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for inclusion, innovation, and customer-focus. Our eleven business resource groups nurture our culture of belonging across the diverse backgrounds and experiences represented across our global footprint.
Hybrid Work Model: We’ve adopted a flexible hybrid working environment (2-3 days a week in the office depending on the role) for our office-based roles while delivering a seamless experience that is digitally and physically connected.
Social Impact: Make an impact in your community with our Social Impact Institute. We offer employees two paid volunteer days off annually and opportunities to get involved with pro-bono consulting projects and Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) initiatives.



DISCLAIMER

The above information in this description has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees within this classification. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities, and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job.

Do you want to be part of a team helping re-invent the way knowledge professionals work? How about a team that works every day to create a more transparent, just and inclusive future? At Thomson Reuters, we’ve been doing just that for almost 160 years. Our industry-leading products and services include highly specialized information-enabled software and tools for legal, tax, accounting and compliance professionals combined with the world’s most global news services – Reuters. We help these professionals do their jobs better, creating more time for them to focus on the things that matter most: advising, advocating, negotiating, governing and informing.

We are powered by the talents of 25,000 employees across more than 75 countries, where everyone has a chance to contribute and grow professionally in flexible work environments that celebrate diversity and inclusion. At a time when objectivity, accuracy, fairness and transparency are under attack, we consider it our duty to pursue them. Sound exciting? Join us and help shape the industries that move society forward.

Accessibility

As a global business, we rely on diversity of culture and thought to deliver on our goals. To ensure we can do that, we seek talented, qualified employees in all our operations around the world regardless of race, color, sex/gender, including pregnancy, gender identity and expression, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, disability, age, marital status, citizen status, veteran status, or any other protected classification under applicable law. Thomson Reuters is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer providing a drug-free workplace.

We also make reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and for sincerely held religious beliefs in accordance with applicable law.

Title: Senior ML Engineer (Zürich)
Description:
You want to operate at the cutting edge of AI, building the strongest defenses in the AI cybersecurity market. You will be increasing the scope and quality of our defenses, and playing a pivotal role in ensuring that GenAI applications can be deployed securely at scale. You will lead the creation of cutting-edge models that perform exceptionally well and operate in real time. This involves continuously identifying edge cases for our detectors and working to collect and generate intricate threat datasets to improve the performance of these models. You will ensure that Lakera can continuously ship the best defenses in the market with a high cadence. Your passion lies in shaping the future, working on ideas that define the secure use of AI in the decades ahead. Your work will play a vital role in ensuring that AI can unleash its best potential–for good.

About Lakera

Lakera is on a mission to ensure AI does what we want it to do. We are heading towards a future where AI agents run our businesses and personal lives. Here at Lakera, we're not just dreaming about the future; we're building the security foundation for it. We empower security teams and builders so that their businesses can adopt AI technologies and unleash the next phase of intelligent computing.

We work with Fortune 500 companies, startups, and foundation model providers to protect them and their users from adversarial misalignment. We are also the company behind Gandalf, the world’s most popular AI security game.

Lakera has offices in San Francisco and Zurich.

We move fast and work with intensity. We act as one team but expect everyone to take substantial ownership and accountability. We prioritize transparency at every level and are committed to always raising the bar in everything we do. We promote diversity of thought as we believe that creates the best outcomes.

Example projects


Extend the scope of one of our detectors to support multiple languages without dropping performance on already supported languages.
Increase the scope where our defenses perform by 100x (e.g., multi-lingual data, code, etc).
Extend modeling and data generation to enable passing additional context to our prompt injection detectors, such as the LLM output and behavioral metadata.
Red team our model to understand the most pressing vulnerabilities of our detectors and prioritize the data collection and generation required to fix them.


What You’ll Bring


You have at least 4 years of experience shipping machine learning models to production, ideally in environments where reliability and quality are key (e.g., autonomous driving, industrial applications, healthcare).
Most of your experience productionizing ML models has been in unstructured data spaces such as NLP and vision.
You have had experience working on end-to-end development of ML models.
You have experience working on the “long tail” of data distribution, bringing models from prototypes to real-world systems.
You aspire to play a pivotal role in defining the future of secure AI within a mission-driven company with ambitious goals.


👉 Let's stay connected! Follow us on LinkedIn, Twitter & Instagram to learn more about what is happening at Lakera.

ℹ️ Join us on Momentum, the slack community for AI Safety and Security everything.

❗To remove your information from our recruitment database, please email privacy@lakera.ai.

Title: Junior Software Engineer
Description:
Du willst Software in einem modernen Umfeld entwickeln? Du magst Effizienz und hast Freude daran, Prozesse zu digitalisieren? Bei Python und GitHub schlägt dein Herz höher? Du magst Wasserfälle aber wenn möglich nur in deiner Freizeit? Du arbeitest lieber in einem kleinen Team mit grossen Zielen als in einem Grossunternehmen?

Dann ist dieser Job etwas für dich! Wir implementieren Odoo für unsere Kunden und digitalisieren, vereinfachen und beschleunigen damit ihre Prozesse.

Was dich erwartet

Du hilfts mit, das schon sehr starke Odoo um den entscheidenden Faktor stärker zu machen. Du erhältst kurze knackige Anforderungen von den Business Analysten, welche du innerhalb eines Sprints umsetzt. Damit der Sprint nicht zum Marathon wird, stehst du im regen Austausch mit den Business Analysten. Deine Kreativität ist dabei jederzeit willkommen. Mit deinen Entwicklungen trägst du zum Projekterfolg massgeblich bei. Dank der Zusammenarbeit mit erfahrenen Odoo Entwicklern profitierst du von einer steilen Lernkurve.

Deine Tätigkeit wird hauptsächlich in Python im Odoo Framework stattfinden, aber auch Schnittstellen zu anderen Systemen sowie Ausflüge in HTML, JS und das gelegentliche CSS machen den Job interessant.

Wir bieten

Du willst mit Leuten arbeiten, die etwas bewegen wollen im Leben: Wollen wir auch
Langweilig ist nicht so deins: Bei uns siehst du in die unterschiedlichsten Branchen
Du lebst nicht (nur) von Luft und Liebe: Marktübliche Vergütung mit definierten Steigerungen
Am Abend länger arbeiten, dafür am Morgen länger schlafen: Flexible Arbeitszeiten
Du willst auch mal was anderes machen: 5 Wochen Ferien
Du bist Sprinter, brauchst aber auch mehr Pausen: Bis zu 10 Wochen Ferien möglich
Zwei Tage Wochenende sind einfach nicht genug: Teilzeit möglich
Dir gefällt deine Wohnung eigentlich ganz gut: Homeoffice auch
Ein Büro in der Stadt ist trotzdem cool: Arbeitsplatz in Oerlikon inkl. Dusche falls du zwischen zwei Meetings zum Sport gehen willst
Am Wochenende gratis Zug fahren ist nice: Du bekommst ein Abo für alle Zonen des ZVV

Über dich

Du bist neugierig und lernst schnell, du bist kreativ und trotzdem strukturiert
Du verfügst über ein abgeschlossenes Studium mit überdurchschnittlichen Noten
Pluspunkt: Du hast bereits Erfahrung mit Business Software
Pluspunkt: Du hast bereits Erfahrung mit dem Odoo Framework

So geht’s weiter

Du schickst uns deine Unterlagen, und wir geben dir innerhalb einer Woche Bescheid. In der zweiten Runde sprechen wir dann per Videocall miteinander, damit du und wir herausfinden, ob wir grundsätzlich zusammenpassen könnten. Falls das so ist, geben wir dir im zweiten Gespräch eine kleine Herausforderung, die wir in der Praxis angetroffen haben. Du erzählst uns dann, wie du das angehen würdest und weshalb. Wenn das auch passt, klären wir noch die vertraglichen Details und schon kanns losgehen!

Show more
HTML:
Du willst Software in einem modernen Umfeld entwickeln? Du magst Effizienz und hast Freude daran, Prozesse zu digitalisieren? Bei Python und GitHub schlägt dein Herz höher? Du magst Wasserfälle aber wenn möglich nur in deiner Freizeit? Du arbeitest lieber in einem kleinen Team mit grossen Zielen als in einem Grossunternehmen?

Dann ist dieser Job etwas für dich! Wir implementieren Odoo für unsere Kunden und digitalisieren, vereinfachen und beschleunigen damit ihre Prozesse.

Was dich erwartet

Du hilfts mit, das schon sehr starke Odoo um den entscheidenden Faktor stärker zu machen. Du erhältst kurze knackige Anforderungen von den Business Analysten, welche du innerhalb eines Sprints umsetzt. Damit der Sprint nicht zum Marathon wird, stehst du im regen Austausch mit den Business Analysten. Deine Kreativität ist dabei jederzeit willkommen. Mit deinen Entwicklungen trägst du zum Projekterfolg massgeblich bei. Dank der Zusammenarbeit mit erfahrenen Odoo Entwicklern profitierst du von einer steilen Lernkurve.

Deine Tätigkeit wird hauptsächlich in Python im Odoo Framework stattfinden, aber auch Schnittstellen zu anderen Systemen sowie Ausflüge in HTML, JS und das gelegentliche CSS machen den Job interessant.

Wir bieten

  • Du willst mit Leuten arbeiten, die etwas bewegen wollen im Leben: Wollen wir auch
  • Langweilig ist nicht so deins: Bei uns siehst du in die unterschiedlichsten Branchen
  • Du lebst nicht (nur) von Luft und Liebe: Marktübliche Vergütung mit definierten Steigerungen
  • Am Abend länger arbeiten, dafür am Morgen länger schlafen: Flexible Arbeitszeiten

  • Zwei Tage Wochenende sind einfach nicht genug: Teilzeit möglich

  • Am Wochenende gratis Zug fahren ist nice: Du bekommst ein Abo für alle Zonen des ZVV

Über dich

  • Du verfügst über ein abgeschlossenes Studium mit überdurchschnittlichen Noten
  • Pluspunkt: Du hast bereits Erfahrung mit Business Software
  • Pluspunkt: Du hast bereits Erfahrung mit dem Odoo Framework

So geht’s weiter

Du schickst uns deine Unterlagen, und wir geben dir innerhalb einer Woche Bescheid. In der zweiten Runde sprechen wir dann per Videocall miteinander, damit du und wir herausfinden, ob wir grundsätzlich zusammenpassen könnten. Falls das so ist, geben wir dir im zweiten Gespräch eine kleine Herausforderung, die wir in der Praxis angetroffen haben. Du erzählst uns dann, wie du das angehen würdest und weshalb. Title: Développeur logiciel Python
Description:
Notre client développe des machines de mesure haute dynamique afin de fournir du contrôle dimensionnel directement en Production.

Poste FIXE. Taux 100%




Responsabilités principales




• Participer à l’élaboration de nouveaux modules pour les solutions clients.

• Assurer le développement de ces modules en Python.

• Réaliser la maintenance de l'existant.

• Rédiger la documentation technique.

• Participer à la génération des versions et à l’intégration chez les clients.




Environnement technique




• Développement : Python, POO

• IDE : Visual Studio Code, Atom, PyCharm

• Méthodologie : Méthodes Agile (Scrum, Kanban) / Projet

• Outils annexes : TFS, Azure Devops, Confluence…

• Frameworks de com : TCP/IP, gRPC, MQTT, OPC-UA…

Profil souhaité




• Ingénieur HES ou équivalent dans les domaines de l’informatique industrielle, la mesure physique ou la robotique, vous avez une bonne connaissance du langage Python et de la POO.

• La maîtrise de l’anglais technique est indispensable.

• Des connaissances sur les sujets suivants seraient un plus : C#(.Net), injection des dépendances, tests unitaires, logiciels de métrologie, les Commandes Numériques, la vision industrielle et la robotique.

• Vous êtes force de proposition et aimez travailler au sein d’une petite équipe flexible et vous savez faire preuve d’autonomie, de réactivité et de pragmatisme.




Nous vous offrons




• Rejoindre une petite PME d’une vingtaine de personnes en pleine évolution

• Un haut degré d’auto-détermination

Title: Développeur Python/Développeuse Python - IAC / DevOps
Description:
📍 Où ? Genève

💼 Contrat ? CDI

📆 Quand ? Dès que possible

🏡 Résidence en Suisse ou volonté de déménager




Vous êtes passionné(e) par l'automatisation, les solutions cloud et les architectures robustes ? Vous souhaitez évoluer dans un environnement dynamique, collaboratif et technique ? Alors ce poste de Développeur Python / DevOps Engineer est fait pour vous !

Notre client dans le secteur bancaire recherche des développeurs passionnés, prêts à mettre leurs compétences au service de l’automatisation des infrastructures et à les accompagner dans leur transition vers le modèle "As code”.

Contrairement à la plupart des offres que vous croiserez, nous ne recherchons pas une expertise approfondie sur des technologies spécifiques. Ce qui compte avant tout, c’est votre état d’esprit et vos compétences en développement.

Ce poste est idéal pour un développeur avec une solide expérience en Python, Java ou Go, et un intérêt marqué pour l’automatisation et les pratiques DevOps. Vous jouerez un rôle clé dans l’automatisation des infrastructures, aussi bien On-premise que Cloud.




🔒Vos missions 🔒

Contribuer à la transformation des plateformes vers l’automatisation, la configuration full as code et le self-service (Kubernetes, Docker, Python, Terraform, Ansible…)
Mettre à profit votre expertise en développement pour concevoir des applications robustes, évolutives et maintenables (Python, Java, Go…)
Améliorer et maintenir les pipelines CI/CD afin de garantir une intégration, un test et un déploiement fluides (GitLab)
Participer à la maintenance de l’environnement existant
Collaborer avec les product owners pour intégrer leurs applications à nos plateformes




⚙️ Stack technique ⚙️

Langages : Python, Java, Go
Outils & Environnements : Kubernetes, Docker, Terraform, Ansible, GitLab, AWS




🧠 Le profil que nous recherchons 🧠

Diplôme d'ingénieur en Informatique ou éequivalent.
Minimum 4 ans d’expérience en tant que développeur logiciel
Expérience avec les pratiques de développement logiciel
Solide maîtrise d’un langage parmi Python, Java ou Go
Intérêt marqué pour Kubernetes, le Cloud, les réseaux et les technologies serveur
Curiosité et envie d’explorer de nouvelles technologies et l’univers DevOps
Proactif(ve), avec un bon esprit d’équipe et une capacité à travailler de manière autonome







Darwin Partners, un véritable partenaire de carrière 🧩

Chez Darwin Partners, nous ne nous contentons pas de recruter : nous accompagnons chaque consultant dans son évolution professionnelle en lui proposant des missions qui correspondent à ses aspirations.

Avec une culture dynamique et axée sur l’impact, nous connectons les meilleurs talents IT à des projets ambitieux, tout en cultivant des relations humaines et authentiques.

👥 Nos clients ? Des entreprises innovantes dans différents secteurs d’activité (banque, assurance, finance, industrie, e-commerce, marchés publics, trading, médical ...) et des projets à forte valeur ajoutée sur différents métiers (étude & développement, fonctionnel, agilité, infrastructure, réseaux, data, cloud ...)

🤝 Notre engagement ? Un suivi régulier, une écoute active et une véritable proximité avec nos talents.

✨ Notre promesse ? Des projets enrichissants et une rémunération à la hauteur de votre talent.




💡 Ce qui fait notre différence au sein de Darwin Partners 💡

Une entreprise à taille humaine et smart, avec une approche personnalisée et bienveillante. Aujourd’hui, nous sommes près de 110 collaborateurs à nous engager au quotidien pour satisfaire nos clients !
Des projets stratégiques et stimulants, où vous pourrez vraiment avoir un impact.
Un accompagnement sur-mesure, avec un suivi régulier et des perspectives d’évolution.
Une flexibilité contractuelle : CDI, freelance, portage salarial … Nous nous adaptons à vos préférences pour construire ensemble la collaboration qui vous convient le mieux.

📌 Notre processus de recrutement 📌

Nous savons que votre temps est précieux, alors chez Darwin Partners, nous faisons simple et efficace !

1️⃣ Premier échange RH – Un moment pour parler de vous, de vos ambitions et de nos opportunités.

2️⃣ Entretien technique et métier – Discussion avec un manager pour valider votre expertise et votre vision de l’agilité.

2️⃣ (Bis) Test technique ou échange avec un consultant expert – Selon le poste, une évaluation technique ou un échange approfondi avec un consultant de notre réseau pour affiner l’adéquation avec la mission et vous donner envie de nous rejoindre.

3️⃣ Entretien client – Rencontre avec l’entreprise partenaire pour un dernier échange avant le GO final.

📩 Prêt(e) à nous rejoindre ?

N’hésitez pas à postuler directement via cette annonce en cliquant sur l’onglet “Candidature Simplifiée”.

Title: Software Engineer Python
Company: Nordwand Group - the IT & Finance Recruitment Company
Description:
Unser Kunde, ein erfolgreiches Unternehmen der Energiewirtschaft, ist auf der Suche nach Verstärkung für das Team am Standort Zürich.




Als Senior Python Engineer übernimmst Du eine zentrale Rolle in der Entwicklung und Wartung datengetriebener Tools für die Energiewirtschaft. Du trägst massgeblich zur Optimierung und Automatisierung von Softwarelösungen bei und setzt «Best Practices» in der Softwareentwicklung um. Zudem stellst Du durch Code- Reviews, technische Dokumentation und die enge Zusammenarbeit mit relevanten Stakeholdern die Qualität und Nachhaltigkeit der entwickelten Lösungen sicher.




Zu Deinen Hauptaufgaben zählen:




Die Entwicklung und Pflege von datengetriebenen Tools mittels Python
Etablierung und Umsetzung von Best Practices, z.B. Clean Code, Design Patterns etc.
Optimierung und Automatisierung von Entwicklungsabläufen
Erstellung und Pflege technischer Dokumentation
Durchführung von Code-Reviews nach aktuellen Standards




Weitere Aufgaben sind:




Die Einführung von Monitoring- und Alerting-Capabilities
Mitarbeit in der Erstellung eines neuen Betriebskonzepts
Unterstützung bei der Optimierung von ETL-Prozessen
Mitwirkung an der Transformation und Migration zur zentralen Datenplattform
Weitergabe von Wissen und Best Practices zur kontinuierlichen Verbesserung und Weiterbildung innerhalb des Teams




Das bringst Du mit:




Erfahrung in der Entwicklung und Pflege von CI/CD-Pipelines
Kenntnisse des Data Engineering, insbesondere mit ETL-Prozessen und Datenintegration
Erfahrung mit Touchpoints oder generelles Interesse in der Arbeit mit modernen Cloud-Technologien (vorzugsweise Azure)
Du verstehst dich als Dienstleister aus Leidenschaft und kommunizierst einwandfrei in Deutsch. Zudem verfügst du über gute Englischkenntnisse.
Rund um das Thema Python kennst du dich sehr gut aus. Gute bis sehr gute Kenntnisse in ETL und CI/CD komplettieren Dein Profil
Du handelst kundenorientiert, arbeitest sehr selbstständig, bist aber dennoch ein Teamplayer
Deine hohe Motivation zeichnet dich aus und du gehst in Deiner Arbeit sehr strukturiert vor. Auch in hektischen Phasen behältst du immer den Überblick und deinen Humor







Das erwartet Dich:




Ob in Zürich mit Home Office Möglichkeit oder im Kombination mit deinem Auslandaufenthalt, arbeiten kannst du nicht nur lokal.
Grossartiger Ort zum Arbeiten: Unser Kunde ist ein Unternehmen mit starken Werten
Tolle Teamkultur: Du wirst Teil eines aufgestellten, dynamischen und hilfsbereiten Teams, das offen und vertrauensvoll miteinander umgeht
Attraktive Anstellungsbedingungen mit einer zusätzlichen Leistungskomponente
Flache Hierarchien und kurze Entscheidungswege
Möglichkeit für regelmässiges Homeoffice und einige Wochen Workation pro Jahr
Coole Firmen-Incentives und Benefits
Kurz: Ein Job mit Perspektive!

Show more

Title: Senior Embedded ML Software Engineer
Description:
Our quest

We are a curious team passionate about pushing the boundaries of physics to develop groundbreaking technology that makes a real difference. Our expertise lies in acoustics, vibration, and control - sorry, no rockets.




Our mission is to establish new ways to innovate and create value with sound.




What you’ll be doing as part of our team

As a full-time Software Rocket Scientist, you'll play a vital role in bringing our acoustic innovations to life. You'll design, develop, and implement software solutions that interface or run on our hardware, enabling us to capture, analyze, and manipulate sound in remarkable ways. You'll collaborate closely with our team of physicists and engineers, translating their knowhow into robust and efficient code. You'll also have opportunities to contribute to the development of embedded systems and signal processing algorithms that power our technology.




What you bring to the table

a degree in computer science, software engineering, or a related field
proven track-record in one or more relevant languages (e.g., Python, C)
a solid understanding of software development principles and best practices
curiosity, a strong drive to learn and a passion for applying state-of-the-art algorithms in real-world projects with relevance
fluent in English and preferably German
a permit allowing you to legally work in Switzerland




What makes us think: Nice!

if you can show familiarity with electronics and acoustics concepts
if you have 5 - 10 years of work experience in a field relevant to us
If you're able to convince us that you actually enjoyed writing that one README file




What you can tell your family & friends

As a Software Rocket Scientist I write the code that helps machines hear and understand the world around them. I'm contributing to technology that could revolutionize industries like robotics, healthcare, and environmental monitoring. It's pretty cool!"







How you apply

Please send your CV complete with an authentic cover letter highlighting why you are a vital contributor to our mission to launch@rocket-science.ch or directly via Linkedin. We only accept direct applications. Applications coming through agencies won’t be considered.




Tell us about your most exciting projects, why you're drawn to our mission and why you think your personality and skills are a match. We're eager to hear from you!




Show more

  • a degree in computer science, software engineering, or a related field
  • proven track-record in one or more relevant languages (e.g., Python, C)
  • a solid understanding of software development principles and best practices
  • curiosity, a strong drive to learn and a passion for applying state-of-the-art algorithms in real-world projects with relevance
  • fluent in English and preferably German
  • a permit allowing you to legally work in Switzerland


What makes us think: Nice!

  • if you can show familiarity with electronics and acoustics concepts
  • if you have 5 - 10 years of work experience in a field relevant to us
  • If you're able to convince us that you actually enjoyed writing that one README file


What you can tell your family & friends

As a Software Rocket Scientist I write the code that helps machines hear and understand the world around them. I'm contributing to technology that could revolutionize industries like robotics, healthcare, and environmental monitoring. It's pretty cool!"



How you apply

Please send your CV complete with an authentic cover letter highlighting why you are a vital contributor to our mission to launch@rocket-science.ch or directly via Linkedin. We only accept direct applications. Applications coming through agencies won’t be considered.


Tell us about your most exciting projects, why you're drawn to our mission and why you think your personality and skills are a match. We're eager to hear from you!

Title: Senior PV Scientist
Description:
On behalf of our client, an international pharma company based in canton Zug, we are seeking a Senior PV Scientist.




This role is fully remote (from Switzerland).




In this role, you will serve as a global product lead for Pharmacovigilance activities within the Safety department including managing PV Scientist(s) assigned to products within the Senior PV Scientist's designated products.







General Information:




Contract type: temporary contract via Randstad
Start date: ASAP
Duration: 1 year (with the possibility of extension)
Location: remote (office based in Baar if needed)







Tasks and responsibilities:




Leads the signal management process (i.e., signal detection, signal tracking, signal documentation, facilitating decisions regarding signals and safety risk, etc.) for assigned product(s) and evaluates safety data and signals as part of ongoing pharmacovigilance activities. Includes synthesis of data from multiple sources and authoring signal evaluation reports.
Leads signaling review process and product Safety Signaling Team meetings.
Provides safety leadership to cross functional project meetings
Leads process for responding to safety questions from regulatory authorities.
Provides strategic input to the authoring of regulatory documents such as PSURs, DSURs, PADERs, Addendum to Clinical Overview
Leads development of Pharmacovigilance Plans, Risk Evaluation and Mitigation Strategy Plans (REMS), and Risk Management Plans (RMPs) including providing safety input to post authorization safety studies (PASS) and additional risk minimization measures
Leads development of the strategy for medical and scientific literature review for safety information
Provides safety leadership to regulatory submissions in collaboration with the Global Safety Officer
Maintains an up to date understanding of relevant global safety regulations and guidelines
Collaborates with Global Safety Officers and other Safety MDs for assigned investigational programs including clinical trial activities (protocol review, ICF review, etc.), safety committee management, data analysis, signal detection, ad hoc requests and other product activities, as assigned.
Leads initiatives for process improvement and consistency regarding aggregate reporting, clinical trial safety oversight, signal management and responding to ad hoc safety questions.
Direct supervision of PV Scientist(s) including hiring, training and mentoring.




A typical day might include:




Working on a post-marketing and/or investigational product to ensure products in clinical trials continue to maintain good standing with countries where studies are ongoing, to ensure clinical studies are completed, and for marketed products, ensures the marketing authorization remains in good standing.
Setting response strategy and authoring safety related health authority requests
Performing routine signal detection and safety surveillance activities
Reviewing key safety documents such as reference safety information, aggregate reports, risk management plans etc, to ensure they meet the required standards
Working cross functionally to deliver process improvement initiatives
Working on safety science related activities (e.g. signal detection/automation methodology, pharmacovigilance research, exploring new data sources such as RWD)




Your profile:




MSc or BSc in biologic or natural science; or health care discipline advanced degree (PhD, MPH, NP, PharmD, etc.) required
Minimum 7 years Pharmacovigilance experience, including experience in safety signal management and aggregate safety reports. Prior management of direct reports preferred.
Understands, interprets, analyzes, and clearly presents scientific and medical data in verbal and written format (including intermediate understanding and application of medical concepts and terminology).
Strong pharmacovigilance and drug development foundation, including knowledge of applicable clinical trial safety regulations and post-marketing safety regulations. Includes knowledge of case processing, expedited reporting rules, and safety database concepts.
Ability to work with complex clinical data to produce robust assessments of safety data. A familiarity of pharmacoepidemiology definitions and their use in pharmacovigilance is desirable for working with safety science research activities.
Knowledge of common data processing software (Excel, PowerPoint, Microsoft Word, Business Objects). Knowledge of common safety database systems.
Demonstrates leadership and interacts collaboratively and effectively in a team environment (including Safety, Clinical Development, Medical Affairs, Clinical Operations, and Regulatory), as well as with external colleagues
Strong organizational skills, including the ability to prioritize independently with minimal supervision

Title: Research assistant/senior scientist position
Description:
50% / July or August 2025

The research group Landscape Ecology and Ecosystems Conservation at the Department of Environmental Sciences invites applications for a research assistant/senior scientist position 50% /July or August 2025

Your position

We are looking for a colleague to join and enrich our research group in the long term. Our applied research evaluates how nature and society interact and how environmental policy and ecosystem management can influence both. We use spatially explicit environmental data to understand the distribution of species and ecosystems across geographic areas and over time and how these interact with human uses/impacts.

Your profile

We are looking for a dynamic, reliable and motivated candidate with a PhD in biology, ecology, environmental sciences or related disciplines (e.g., forestry, biostatistics, remote sensing) and at least 4 years of postdoctoral experience. The candidate will develop an independent line of research within the field of conservation biology and applied ecology and team up with group members to develop new ideas in this field. The position includes teaching in Ecology and Global Change-related subjects within the framework of the Master Course on Sustainable Development and supervision of students. Interaction with the group and associated partners requires spoken and written English and (ideally) German language skills.

We offer you

We offer an interesting position in an international and interdisciplinary research environment at the University of Basel. The workload of the position is 50% and salary and social benefits are provided according to the University of Basel rules. The position will initially be for four years with the option of becoming permanent, depending on the performance of the candidate. A 50% research position allows applications to competitive funding / grants.

Application / Contact

Please upload your application via our online platform. lt should include: a motivation letter (max. 2 page), a CV, copy of PhD degree, and the contact details of 3 referees. We especially encourage applications from women and members of underrepresented groups in academic institutions. Review of applications will begin on April 1st 2025, and will continue until the position is filled.

For further information please contact Prof. Dr. Alejandra Morán Ordóñez (alejandra.moranordonez@unibas.ch)

https://alemoranordonez.wordpress.com/

Apply

www.unibas.ch

Title: Software Engineer
Description:
Job Description

Software Engineer - Java, JVM, Kotlin, Spring boot

Seniority: Junior/ Mid level

Location: Lausanne

Contract type: Full-time Permanent

Work Environment: Hybrid- 3 days in the office a week

Disclaimer: To be considered, applicants must be eligible to work within Switzerland. We will not be able to provide Visa sponsorship.

At Evooq, we are building an ecosystem of solutions that combine data, technology and investment expertise. Finance professionals use our solutions to rapidly identify investment opportunities, make informed decisions and manage the risk and the lifecycle of the investments. Moreover, Evooq is organized through highly autonomous teams and by privileging trust and responsibility.

We are expanding our core engineering team and seeking a passionate and motivated Software Engineer (Junior/ Mid level) to join us in our high-performing and agile collaborative environment.

As a Software Engineer, you will work on our core platform building new/enhancing our features whilst utilizing modern technology like Java 17, Kotlin, Spring Boot and Microservices architecture.


Take full ownership of the product you are crafting - You will be involved in the full life cycle of software engineering including requirement analysis, prototyping, design, implementation, deployment, monitoring, and support.
Ensure correctness, maintainability, and sustainability of the delivered solutions, following and promoting our established mindset for well-crafted design, code, and testing.


Qualifications


A can-do attitude and abundance mindset - you'll be involved in the full software life cycle, including decision-making from design to production.
Good taste and basic knowledge of modern, scalable software architecture.
Any knowledge of distributed systems is a plus.
Hands-on experience in designing and implementing high-quality modern APIs and back-end systems
Passion about writing clean code. We appreciate practices like Domain-Driven Design, BDD, or TDD.
Ability to analyze and challenge business requirements, brainstorm technology ideas, and design/build efficient cloud solutions
Team spirit: You are a great teammate, making sure that everyone on your team feels valued and is excited to work with you
Ability to complete projects with minimal supervision and direction
Passion, curiosity, pragmatism, and humility. We favor code and demos over lengthy discussions.


Technical Skills required:


Languages: mainly JVM-based, like Java and Kotlin.
Frameworks: Spring, Docker, Elastic Stack, Prometheus, Grafana, Redis, Maven/Gradle and RabbitMQ
Basic knowledge of software building process including versioning, package, and delivering.
Good knowledge of relational databases like PostgreSQL and Cassandra


Additional Information

Evooq is a global provider of technology-driven solutions for wealth managers. We are building an ecosystem that combines data, technology and investment expertise to make personalised investment scalable.

Wealth managers use our solutions to deliver personalised advice to investors with high-quality content and the best investment products.

We are headquartered in Lausanne, with additional offices in Zurich and Singapore. We operate as a group of highly autonomous teams that take responsibility for their projects and interact with each other based on mutual trust.
